head.title: Where to See More Of the Murals

hedline.hl1: Where to See More Of the Murals

abstract.p: List of Connecticut locations of murals by Works Progress Administration artist James Daugherty (S)

block.p: ''The Life and Times of General Israel Putnam of Connectiut'' is on display in the Greenwich Library. Following is a list where the public may view other works by James Daugherty.
''The Life and Times of General Israel Putnam of Connectiut'' is on display in the Greenwich Library. Following is a list where the public may view other works by James Daugherty.

* In Bridgeport, at the Discovery Museum, there are four murals (oil on masonite) from 1935: ''Spring,'' ''Summer,'' ''Winter,'' ''Autumn''; at the Housatonic Museum of Art: ''The First Billion Years'' (oil on canvas board).
* In Darien, a book illustration can be seen at the Darien Historical Society.
* In New Britain, ''Driving the Rails,'' in charcoal and conte crayon on paper, can be seen at the New Britain Museum of American Art.

* In New Haven, several of James Daugherty's works are on view in the Societe Anonyme collection at the Yale University Art Gallery: an oil on burlap wall decoration (c. 1918-20), ''Two Figures in Landscape,'' a colored aquatint (c. 1925) and a linoleum cut on paper from 1925.
* In New London, at the Lyman Allyn Art Museum, there are the ''Arrival of the 6:20,'' a tempera on board as well as six mural sketches in watercolor or gouache on paper.
* And in Westport, the Westport Public Schhol Collection, includes ''Research,'' an oil on board from 1961 and one pastel.
